title: Authors and Citation
text: Anders Hagen Jarmund. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jarmund (2025). DataFindR: Automated LLM Study Assessment Data Extraction. R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {DataFindR: Automated LLM Study Assessment and Data Extraction},   author = {Anders Hagen Jarmund},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

what: Automated LLM Study Assessment and Data Extraction
title: Automated LLM Study Assessment and Data Extraction
text: DataFindR package provides tools leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) semi-automate screening data extraction steps systematic reviews. designed populate project created managed metawoRld package. Key features include: * Fetching metadata (Title/Abstract) DOIs/PMIDs. * Assessing study relevance using LLMs guided project criteria stored metawoRld. * Extracting specific data points full text using LLMs guided data schema stored metawoRld. * Caching results avoid redundant API calls costs. * interactive Shiny app screening assistance. Please see Conceptual Overview vignette hosted metawoRld package detailed explanation entire living review pipeline DataFindR fits . (Replace link actual URL).

title: Automated LLM Study Assessment and Data Extraction
code: # Assuming DataFindR is on GitHub (replace 'andjar/DataFindR') # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("andjar/DataFindR")  # DataFindR requires metawoRld # remotes::install_github("andjar/metawoRld")

title: Automated LLM Study Assessment and Data Extraction
code: library(DataFindR)  # --- Prerequisites --- # 1. API key set (e.g., OPENAI_API_KEY in .Renviron, then restart R) # 2. A metawoRld project exists at the specified path # Example metawoRld setup (see metawoRld documentation): proj_path <- file.path(tempdir(), "assess_example_proj") if(!dir.exists(proj_path)) {    try(metawoRld::create_metawoRld(proj_path, "Assess Example", "Desc",       inclusion_criteria=c("Human","Pregnancy","Cytokine"), exclusion_criteria=c("Animal","Review"))) }   # --- Assess a study --- pmid <- "31772108" # Example relevant PMID if(dir.exists(proj_path)) {    assessment_result <- tryCatch(      df_assess_relevance(         identifier = pmid,         metawoRld_path = proj_path,         email = "your.email@example.com" # Replace if needed      ),      error = function(e) print(paste("Assessment failed:", e$message))    )    print(assessment_result) } else {    print("Skipping assessment example: metawoRld project setup failed.") }   # Or use the Shiny App # df_shiny_assess()  # --- Clean up --- # unlink(proj_path, recursive = TRUE)

title: Copy templates for DataFindR — copy_datafindr_files
text: Imports templates prompts schemas

title: Copy templates for DataFindR — copy_datafindr_files
code: copy_datafindr_files(path, overwrite = FALSE)

title: Copy templates for DataFindR — copy_datafindr_files
text: path Character vector. Target path overwrite Boolean. Default FALSE

title: Copy templates for DataFindR — copy_datafindr_files
text: return value, copies files specified path

what: Assess Relevance for a Batch of Study Identifiers — df_assess_batch
title: Assess Relevance for a Batch of Study Identifiers — df_assess_batch
text: Runs relevance assessment workflow (df_assess_relevance) multiple DOIs/PMIDs, leveraging caching providing summary results.

title: Assess Relevance for a Batch of Study Identifiers — df_assess_batch
code: df_assess_batch(   chat,   identifiers,   metawoRld_path,   force_fetch = FALSE,   force_assess = FALSE,   email = NULL,   ncbi_api_key = NULL,   stop_on_error = FALSE,   ... )

title: Assess Relevance for a Batch of Study Identifiers — df_assess_batch
text: identifiers Character vector. vector DOIs /PMIDs. metawoRld_path Character string. Path root metawoRld project. force_fetch Logical. TRUE, bypass metadata cache identifiers. force_assess Logical. TRUE, bypass assessment cache identifiers. email Character string (optional). Email NCBI Entrez. ncbi_api_key Character string (optional). NCBI API key. stop_on_error Logical. TRUE, batch process stops single assessment fails. FALSE (default), attempts process identifiers reports errors summary. ... Additional arguments passed df_assess_relevance subsequently LLM API call function (e.g., temperature). service Character string. LLM service use (e.g., "openai"). model Character string. specific LLM model name.

title: Assess Relevance for a Batch of Study Identifiers — df_assess_batch
text: data frame (tibble) summarizing assessment results identifier, columns: identifier DOI PMID. status "Success" "Failure". decision Assessment decision ("Include", "Exclude", etc.) status "Success". score Confidence score status "Success". rationale LLM rationale status "Success". error_message error message status "Failure". Also prints progress summary information console. Assessment results saved cache within metawoRld project.

title: Assess Relevance for a Batch of Study Identifiers — df_assess_batch
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # --- Prerequisites --- # 1. Set API key: usethis::edit_r_environ("project") -> add OPENAI_API_KEY=sk-... -> Restart R # 2. Create a dummy metawoRld project proj_path <- file.path(tempdir(), "assess_batch_proj") metawoRld::create_metawoRld(    proj_path,    project_name = "Test Batch Assessment",    project_description = "Testing DataFindR batch assessment",    inclusion_criteria = c("Human study", "Pregnancy", "Serum or Plasma", "Cytokine measurement"),    exclusion_criteria = c("Animal study", "Review article", "Non-English") )  # --- Identifiers from a hypothetical search --- ids_to_assess <- c(   "31772108", # Should likely be Include   "25376210", # Should likely be Include   "invalid_pmid", # Should fail fetch   "10.1038/nature14539" # Example DOI (Nature review, likely Exclude) )  # --- Run Batch Assessment --- batch_results <- df_assess_batch(   identifiers = ids_to_assess,   metawoRld_path = proj_path,   email = "your.email@example.com", # Replace with your email   service = "openai",   model = "gpt-3.5-turbo",   stop_on_error = FALSE # Continue processing even if one fails )  # --- View Results --- print(batch_results)  # --- Clean up --- unlink(proj_path, recursive = TRUE) } # }

what: Assess Study Relevance using LLM — df_assess_relevance
title: Assess Study Relevance using LLM — df_assess_relevance
text: Fetches metadata identifier, generates prompt based project criteria, calls LLM API assess relevance based Title/Abstract, parses response, caches results.

title: Assess Study Relevance using LLM — df_assess_relevance
code: df_assess_relevance(   chat,   identifier,   metawoRld_path,   force_fetch = FALSE,   force_assess = FALSE,   email = NULL,   ncbi_api_key = NULL,   ... )

title: Assess Study Relevance using LLM — df_assess_relevance
text: chat ellmer chat object. identifier Character string. DOI PMID study. metawoRld_path Character string. Path root metawoRld project. force_fetch Logical. TRUE, bypass metadata cache re-fetch online sources. Defaults FALSE. force_assess Logical. TRUE, bypass assessment cache re-run LLM assessment. Defaults FALSE. email Character string (optional). Email NCBI Entrez. ncbi_api_key Character string (optional). NCBI API key. ... Additional arguments passed underlying LLM API call function (e.g., temperature, max_tokens passed .call_llm_openai). service Character string. LLM service use (currently "openai"). model Character string. specific LLM model name.

title: Assess Study Relevance using LLM — df_assess_relevance
text: list containing structured assessment result (decision, score, rationale) aborts critical failure.

title: Assess Study Relevance using LLM — df_assess_relevance
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # --- Prerequisites --- # 1. Set API key: usethis::edit_r_environ("project") -> add OPENAI_API_KEY=sk-... -> Restart R # 2. Create a dummy metawoRld project proj_path <- file.path(tempdir(), "assess_test_proj") metawoRld::create_metawoRld(    proj_path,    project_name = "Test Assessment",    project_description = "Testing DataFindR assessment",    inclusion_criteria = c("Human study", "Pregnancy", "Serum or Plasma", "Cytokine measurement"),    exclusion_criteria = c("Animal study", "Review article", "Non-English") )  # --- Run Assessment --- pmid <- "31772108" # Example PMID relevant to cytokines/pregnancy tryCatch({   assessment_res <- df_assess_relevance(      identifier = pmid,      metawoRld_path = proj_path,      email = "your.email@example.com", # Replace with your email      service = "openai",      model = "gpt-3.5-turbo" # Use a cheaper model for testing initially   )   print(assessment_res)    # --- Run again (should use cache) ---   assessment_res_cached <- df_assess_relevance(pmid, proj_path, email = "your.email@example.com")   print(assessment_res_cached)    # --- Force re-assessment ---   assessment_res_forced <- df_assess_relevance(pmid, proj_path, email = "your.email@example.com", force_assess = TRUE)   print(assessment_res_forced)  }, error = function(e) {   message("Assessment failed: ", e$message) })  # --- Clean up --- unlink(proj_path, recursive = TRUE) } # }

what: Clear DataFindR Cache within a metawoRld Project — df_clear_cache
title: Clear DataFindR Cache within a metawoRld Project — df_clear_cache
text: Removes cached files specific identifier entire cache.

title: Clear DataFindR Cache within a metawoRld Project — df_clear_cache
code: df_clear_cache(identifier = NULL, type = NULL, metawoRld_path)

title: Clear DataFindR Cache within a metawoRld Project — df_clear_cache
text: identifier original identifier (e.g., DOI) clear cache . NULL (default), clears entire DataFindR cache project. Use caution! type Cache type(s) clear: "assessment", "extraction", "metadata", vector like c("assessment", "extraction"). NULL (default), clears types given identifier(s). metawoRld_path Path metawoRld project containing cache.

title: Clear DataFindR Cache within a metawoRld Project — df_clear_cache
text: Invisibly returns TRUE deletion operations attempted (guarantee success every file permissions fail).

what: Extract Data for a Batch of Studies using LLM — df_extract_batch
title: Extract Data for a Batch of Studies using LLM — df_extract_batch
text: Runs LLM data extraction workflow multiple studies, taking paths full-text files input. Saves raw JSON output LLM extraction cache within metawoRld project. import metawoRld. Use df_import_batch subsequently import cached results.

title: Extract Data for a Batch of Studies using LLM — df_extract_batch
code: df_extract_batch(   chat,   identifiers,   paper_paths,   metawoRld_path,   force_extract = FALSE,   stop_on_error = FALSE,   ellmer_timeout_s = 300,   ... )

title: Extract Data for a Batch of Studies using LLM — df_extract_batch
text: identifiers Character vector. vector DOIs /PMIDs studies identified relevant (e.g., "Include" assessment decision). paper_paths Character vector. Named vector list names identifiers (matching identifiers argument) values file paths corresponding full-text plain text (.txt) files. metawoRld_path Character string. Path root metawoRld project. force_extract Logical. TRUE, bypass extraction cache re-run LLM extraction even cached JSON exists. Defaults FALSE. stop_on_error Logical. TRUE, stop batch single extraction fails. Defaults FALSE. ... Additional arguments passed LLM API call function (e.g., temperature, max_tokens). service Character string. LLM service use (e.g., "openai"). model Character string. specific LLM model name (e.g., "gpt-4-turbo").

title: Extract Data for a Batch of Studies using LLM — df_extract_batch
text: data frame (tibble) summarizing extraction attempt identifier, columns: identifier DOI PMID. status "Success" (LLM ran, JSON saved), "Cached" (used existing cache), "Skipped" (e.g., missing paper path), "Failure". cache_file Path saved/checked cache file status "Success" "Cached". error_message error message status "Failure". Also prints progress summary information.

what: Fetch Metadata for a Study Identifier (DOI or PMID) — df_fetch_metadata
title: Fetch Metadata for a Study Identifier (DOI or PMID) — df_fetch_metadata
text: Retrieves bibliographic metadata (title, abstract, authors, year, journal) given DOI PMID using online services (Crossref, PubMed).

title: Fetch Metadata for a Study Identifier (DOI or PMID) — df_fetch_metadata
code: df_fetch_metadata(identifier, email = NULL, ncbi_api_key = NULL)

title: Fetch Metadata for a Study Identifier (DOI or PMID) — df_fetch_metadata
text: identifier Character string. DOI PMID study. email Character string (optional). email address, recommended NCBI Entrez politeness fetching PubMed. provided, rentrez might issue warning. ncbi_api_key Character string (optional). NCBI API key potentially higher rate limits. Set using rentrez::set_entrez_key().

title: Fetch Metadata for a Study Identifier (DOI or PMID) — df_fetch_metadata
text: list containing fetched metadata (identifier, type, title, abstract, authors, year, journal) NULL fetching fails identifier type recognized. Issues warnings failure.

title: Fetch Metadata for a Study Identifier (DOI or PMID) — df_fetch_metadata
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Fetch metadata for a known PMID (requires internet connection) pmid_meta <- df_fetch_metadata("25376210", email = "your.email@example.com") print(pmid_meta)  # Fetch metadata for a known DOI (requires internet connection and rcrossref) doi_meta <- df_fetch_metadata("10.1038/nature14539", email = "your.email@example.com") print(doi_meta)  # Example of a potentially invalid identifier invalid_meta <- df_fetch_metadata("invalid-id") print(invalid_meta) } # }

what: Import Cached Extraction Data for a Batch of Studies — df_import_batch
title: Import Cached Extraction Data for a Batch of Studies — df_import_batch
text: Reads cached extraction data (JSON format saved df_extract_batch manually) multiple studies imports specified metawoRld project using df_import_extraction.

title: Import Cached Extraction Data for a Batch of Studies — df_import_batch
code: df_import_batch(   identifiers,   metawoRld_path,   overwrite = FALSE,   validate_json = TRUE,   merge_metadata = TRUE,   stop_on_error = FALSE )

title: Import Cached Extraction Data for a Batch of Studies — df_import_batch
text: identifiers Character vector. vector DOIs /PMIDs studies cached extraction data ready import. metawoRld_path Character string. Path root target metawoRld project. overwrite Logical. Passed metawoRld::add_study_data via df_import_extraction. TRUE, overwrite existing study data metawoRld project. Defaults FALSE. validate_json Logical. Passed df_import_extraction. TRUE, validate cached JSON schema importing. Defaults TRUE. merge_metadata Logical. Passed df_import_extraction. TRUE, merge cached bibliographic metadata extracted metadata. Defaults TRUE. stop_on_error Logical. TRUE, stop batch single import fails. Defaults FALSE.

title: Import Cached Extraction Data for a Batch of Studies — df_import_batch
text: data frame (tibble) summarizing import attempt identifier, columns: identifier DOI PMID. status "Success", "Skipped" (e.g., cache file missing), "Failure". metawoRld_study_path Path study directory import successful. error_message error message status "Failure" "Skipped". Also prints progress summary information.

what: Import Extracted Study Data into a metawoRld Project — df_import_extraction
title: Import Extracted Study Data into a metawoRld Project — df_import_extraction
text: Reads cached extraction JSON data study, validates project schema, optionally merges cached metadata, transforms , imports metawoRld project structure using metawoRld::add_study_data.

title: Import Extracted Study Data into a metawoRld Project — df_import_extraction
code: df_import_extraction(   identifier,   metawoRld_path,   overwrite = FALSE,   validate_json = TRUE,   merge_metadata = TRUE )

title: Import Extracted Study Data into a metawoRld Project — df_import_extraction
text: identifier Character string. DOI PMID study import. metawoRld_path Character string. Path root target metawoRld project. overwrite Logical. Passed metawoRld::add_study_data. directory study already exists metawoRld/data/, contents overwritten? Defaults FALSE. validate_json Logical. extracted JSON content validated project schema internal links importing? Defaults TRUE. merge_metadata Logical. cached metadata (Title, Authors, Year, Journal, DOI, Abstract fetched via df_fetch_metadata) merged metadata section extraction, prioritizing fetched values specific fields? Defaults TRUE.

title: Import Extracted Study Data into a metawoRld Project — df_import_extraction
text: Invisibly returns path study directory within metawoRld project successful, otherwise aborts error.

what: Launch Shiny App for Extracting Study Data — df_shiny_extract
title: Launch Shiny App for Extracting Study Data — df_shiny_extract
text: Launches Shiny application manage data extraction phase. helps identify studies pending extraction, generate prompts, optionally run LLM extraction, allow manual JSON input/editing, save results cache.

title: Launch Shiny App for Extracting Study Data — df_shiny_extract
code: df_shiny_extract(launch.browser = TRUE, ...)

title: Launch Shiny App for Extracting Study Data — df_shiny_extract
text: launch.browser Logical, passed shiny::runApp. Whether launch app default browser. ... Additional arguments passed shiny::runApp (e.g., port, host).

title: Launch Shiny App for Extracting Study Data — df_shiny_extract
text: return value; runs Shiny application.

title: Launch Shiny App for Extracting Study Data — df_shiny_extract
text: running app: Ensure metawoRld DataFindR packages installed accessible. Ensure target metawoRld project directory exists contains valid _metawoRld.yml. Ensure assessment results exist project's cache (.metawoRld_cache/datafindr/assessment/). triggering API calls, ensure relevant API key (e.g., OPENAI_API_KEY) set environment. LLM extraction, currently need provide path plain text file containing full paper content. PDF processing within app yet implemented. rclipboard package needed 'Copy Prompt' button.

what: Generate LLM Prompt for Extracting Study Data — .generate_extraction_prompt
title: Generate LLM Prompt for Extracting Study Data — .generate_extraction_prompt
text: Creates detailed prompt LLM based schema defined metawoRld project, guiding extraction data primarily Methods, Results, Tables/Figures full research paper. fetches schema directly specified project path.

title: Generate LLM Prompt for Extracting Study Data — .generate_extraction_prompt
code: .generate_extraction_prompt(   identifier = NULL,   fetched_metadata = NULL,   prompt_template = readr::read_file(system.file(fs::path("prompts",     "_extraction_prompt.txt"), package = "DataFindR")) )

title: Generate LLM Prompt for Extracting Study Data — .generate_extraction_prompt
text: identifier Character string (optional). study identifier (DOI/PMID) potentially pre-fill reference prompt. Can used default study_id. fetched_metadata List (optional). Pre-fetched metadata (e.g., df_fetch_metadata) containing fields like title, authors, year etc. provided, prompt can instruct LLM focus less . metawoRld_path Character string. Path root metawoRld project containing _metawoRld.yml file schema.

title: Generate LLM Prompt for Extracting Study Data — .generate_extraction_prompt
text: Character string. formatted LLM prompt data extraction.

title: Generate LLM Prompt for Extracting Study Data — .generate_extraction_prompt
code:
if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # --- Setup: Create a dummy metawoRld project --- proj_path <- file.path(tempdir(), "prompt_test_proj_full") metawoRld::create_metawoRld(    proj_path,    project_name = "Prompt Generation Test Full",    project_description = "Testing prompt generation",    inclusion_criteria = c("Human", "Pregnancy"),    exclusion_criteria = c("Animal")    # Assuming default schema is created inside ) doi <- "10.1234/test.doi.full"  # Example with pre-fetched metadata fetched_meta_example <- list(     identifier = doi, type = "doi", title = "Pre-Fetched Title",     authors = list("Smith J", "Doe A"), year = 2023, journal = "Fetched Journal",     abstract = "Fetched abstract text..." )  # --- Generate the prompt (with fetched metadata hint) --- extraction_prompt_with_meta <- df_generate_extraction_prompt(     metawoRld_path = proj_path,     identifier = doi,     fetched_metadata = fetched_meta_example ) cat("--- Prompt with Fetched Metadata Hint --- 
") # cat(extraction_prompt_with_meta) # View the generated prompt  # --- Generate the prompt (without fetched metadata hint) --- extraction_prompt_no_meta <- df_generate_extraction_prompt(     metawoRld_path = proj_path,     identifier = doi,     fetched_metadata = NULL # Explicitly NULL ) cat("
--- Prompt without Fetched Metadata Hint --- 
") # cat(extraction_prompt_no_meta) # View the generated prompt  # --- Clean up --- unlink(proj_path, recursive = TRUE) } # }

what: Validate extracted data against a schema definition (list format). — .validate_extracted_data
title: Validate extracted data against a schema definition (list format). — .validate_extracted_data
text: Checks structure, types, required fields extracted data conform rules defined schema list (parsed YAML).

title: Validate extracted data against a schema definition (list format). — .validate_extracted_data
code: .validate_extracted_data(extracted_data, schema)

title: Validate extracted data against a schema definition (list format). — .validate_extracted_data
text: extracted_data list/data frame structure returned ellmer::extract_data. schema schema definition R list, typically loaded YAML using function like get_schema.

title: Validate extracted data against a schema definition (list format). — .validate_extracted_data
text: list validation error messages. empty list indicates successful validation. error message includes path problematic node.

title: Validate extracted data against a schema definition (list format). — .validate_extracted_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Assume schema_list is loaded from YAML using get_schema() # Assume llm_output is the result from chat$extract_data(..., type = ellmer_schema)  schema_definition <- get_schema(".") # Or path to your schema YAML # llm_output <- chat$extract_data(...) # Run your extraction  validation_errors <- validate_extracted_data(llm_output, schema_definition)  if (length(validation_errors) == 0) {   print("Validation successful!") } else {   print("Validation failed with the following errors:")   purrr::walk(validation_errors, print) # Requires purrr package   # Or use base R:   # invisible(lapply(validation_errors, print)) } } # }

what: Parse a YAML file defining a schema into an ellmer type object structure. — parse_yaml_to_ellmer_schema
title: Parse a YAML file defining a schema into an ellmer type object structure. — parse_yaml_to_ellmer_schema
text: Parse YAML file defining schema ellmer type object structure.

title: Parse a YAML file defining a schema into an ellmer type object structure. — parse_yaml_to_ellmer_schema
code: parse_yaml_to_ellmer_schema(yaml_path)

title: Parse a YAML file defining a schema into an ellmer type object structure. — parse_yaml_to_ellmer_schema
text: yaml_path Path YAML file containing schema definition.

title: Parse a YAML file defining a schema into an ellmer type object structure. — parse_yaml_to_ellmer_schema
text: ellmer type object (e.g., type_object, type_array) representing schema.

title: Parse a YAML file defining a schema into an ellmer type object structure. — parse_yaml_to_ellmer_schema
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Assuming 'schema.yaml' exists and contains the schema definition ellmer_schema <- parse_yaml_to_ellmer_schema("schema.yaml")  # You can then use this schema with ellmer::extract_data # chat <- ellmer::chat_openai() # extracted_data <- chat$extract_data(paper_text, type = ellmer_schema) } # }

what: Read all datafindr cache files from a metawoRld project — read_all_from_cache
title: Read all datafindr cache files from a metawoRld project — read_all_from_cache
text: Scans datafindr cache directory within metawoRld project, reads valid cached JSON files (assessment, extraction, metadata), parses , returns organized nested list.

title: Read all datafindr cache files from a metawoRld project — read_all_from_cache
code: read_all_from_cache(   type = c("assessment", "extraction", "metadata"),   metawoRld_path )

title: Read all datafindr cache files from a metawoRld project — read_all_from_cache
text: metawoRld_path path metawoRld project directory, contains datafindr cache subdirectory.

title: Read all datafindr cache files from a metawoRld project — read_all_from_cache
text: named list. top-level names sanitized identifiers found cache. element list containing parsed data, named type ("assessment", "extraction", "metadata"). Returns empty list (list()) cache directory exist valid cache files found.

title: Read all datafindr cache files from a metawoRld project — read_all_from_cache
text: function identifies files matching pattern <sanitized_id>_<type>.json within assessment, extraction, metadata subdirectories datafindr cache. attempts parse valid file JSON. Files parsed match naming convention skipped warning.
